questions.question_text: The Knowledge bases searched for the Knowledge results section on an HR Case are determined by what?

choices.B: HR Service, Topic Category, Activity Category, Activities, COE.
choices.D: HR Service, Topic Detail, Topic Category, COE.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
HR Implementation ebook page 31

Selected Answer: D
correct

questions.question_text:
When gathering requirements for HR Services, it is best to begin by defining the Service then working upwards, categorizing in progressively more detail.
What are the basic categories used?
If a knowledge base and its articles have no user criteria selected, a user without a role can do what?

choices.C: can neither read nor contribute articles

discussion.content:
There seems to be a contradiction in the documentation and the settings:

This note indicates it's B:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-servicenow-platform/page/product/knowledge-management/task/t_SelectUserCriteria.html

But it depends on a property to deny access which is turned on by default - that seems to indicate it's C:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/knowledge-management/reference/r_KnowledgeProperties.html

comments.content:
based in the description for [glide.knowman.block_access_with_no_user_criteria] "Enter the value as true to deny *contribute access* to a knowledge base when Can Contribute or Can Read user criteria isnâ€™t set."
The default value for the property is "true"

Based on this description, I believe B is still the correct answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
correct

questions.question_text: How does ServiceNow know which HR Template to use on an HR Case?

choices.A: The HR Template is referenced on the HR Service record.
choices.D: The HR Template is selected directly on the Catalog item.
choices.B: The HR Template is referenced on the record producer form.
choices.C: Each COE has a specific HR Template.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think the right answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Template field is on the HR Service record and the Record Producer, but for HR, the record to update is HR Service so A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A IS CORRECT
the answer is A

Answer is A

questions.question_text: What are the key differentiators between an HR Profile record and a User record? (Choose three.)

choices.C: The HR Profile includes employee organizational information like Colleagues.
choices.D: The HR Profile stores login credential information.
choices.B: The HR Profile includes group membership information.
choices.A: The HR Profile stores the employee's assigned delegates.
choices.F: The HR Profile is intended to store confidential employee data that is pertinent for HR.
choices.E: The HR Profile may include employee marital status.
